{"step_by_step_thinking": "The McRoberts maneuver involves hyperflexion of the thigh over the abdomen. This maneuver is commonly used during childbirth to relieve shoulder dystocia. During the maneuver, the pressure on the nerves in the pelvic region can cause injury. The nerve commonly involved in this maneuver is the Lumbosacral trunk, which is a major nerve that arises from the lumbar plexus and contributes to the formation of the sciatic nerve. Therefore, the correct answer is C. Lumbosacral trunk.", "answer_choice": "C"}
